question: Specific reaction of Hg₂²⁺
answer: It reacts with diphenyl carbazide to give violet colour

question: solubility of sulphides of Group IIB in (NH₄)₂S, (NH₄)₂S₂ and alkali hydroxides
answer:
All sulphides of Group IIB except SnS are soluble in ammonium sulphide.
All sulphides of Group IIB are soluble in ammonium polysulphide.
All sulphides of Group IIB except SnS are soluble in alkali hydroxide solution.

question: Hg²⁺ reaction with Co(SCN)₂
answer: Deep blue ppt of Co[Hg(SCN)₄] is formed

question: Bi³⁺ reaction with KI
answer:
BiI₃↓(black) which dissolves in excess KI to form orange coloured solution of [BiI₄]⁻
BiI₃ when heated in water turns orange due to formation of BiOI (bismuthyl iodide)

question: Test of Bismuth due to induced reaction
CuS with KCN
answer:
2CuS + CN⁻ →2[Cu(CN)₄]³⁻ + S₂²⁻
colourless tetracyanocuprate(l) ions and disulphide ions are formed

question: Ag₂S can be precipitated from which complexes of silver
answer:
It can be precipitated from all the following complexes:
diammine-, di-cyanato- or dithiosulphato-argentate complexes

question: Reaction of Sn with concentrated HNO₃
Fe²⁺ with KCN
answer: Fe(CN)₂↓(yellow-brown ppt) which dissolves in excess to form pale yellow solution of [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻

question: Fe³⁺ reaction separately with Sn²⁺, I⁻, NH₂OH and N₂H₄
Cr³⁺ with NH₃
answer: Cr(OH)₃↓(grey-green ppt) which dissolve in excess to form [Cr(NH₃)]³⁺ (violet or pink solution)

question: Co with KNO₂ with CH₃COOH solution (specific test)
Vogel Reaction, Co²⁺ with SCN⁻
answer:
[Co(SCN)₄]²⁻ ( blue color solution)
forms in neutral or acidic medium

question: Mn²⁺ with NaOH
answer:
Mn(OH)₂↓(white) which turns brown on exposure to air due to formation of MnO(OH)₂
Similar reaction with NH₃

question: Specific test for Na
answer: Yellow ppt with Uranyl-Mg-acetate or Uranyl-Zn-acetate

question: Is CuS soluble in concentrated H₂SO₄
Group I sulphide reaction with HNO₃
answer:
PbS → PbSO₄↓(white ppt)
HgS → Hg₂(NO₃)₂S↓(white ppt)
Ag₂S → dissolves
